Subject: English
AssessmentDescription: Students were invited to ‘write an analysis of the ways in which arguments, written and spoken language and visuals were used … to persuade the intended audience to share a point of view.’ As with the other sections of the exam, this section was assessed holistically using the assessment criteria and expected qualities.

Subject: English
AssessmentDescription: Benchmarks were used to establish the standard required in each of three interrelated skills.

Subject: English
AssessmentSkill: The capacity to explain strategic sequencing of ideas to persuade

Subject: English
AssessmentSkill: The capacity to explain the role of written and visual language in presenting and developing the argument

Subject: English
AssessmentSkill: The capacity to explain the ways argument and language function together to persuade the intended audience

Subject: English
AssessmentSkill: The capacity to communicate these ideas.
